answerText: Walt Whitman[10] This poet wrote about how lilacs "emerge just as sweet" as the author's heart in "Threnody." Her poem "Resumé" proposes various methods of suicide before concluding "You might as well live."
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 10 | 2 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: For 10 points each, name these poets who wrote lines about lilacs. [10] This poet asked "what shall I hang on the chamber walls?" in his poem "When Lilacs Last in the Door-yard Bloom'd," which mourns the death of Lincoln.
